what: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: R package parsing Farm Credit Administration (“FCA”) Call Report data tidy R data frames.

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: can install {fcall} GitHub :

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: FCA publishes Call Report data quarterly basis https://www.fca.gov/bank-oversight/call-report-data--download. September 2023, data represents set 72 .TXT files. files represent 36 datasets. files prefixed “D_” contain metadata (column names, data types, etc.) associated file containing raw, header-less comma-separated data. example, file starts “D_INST” contains metadata file starts “INST_”. , datasets structured way makes data analysis difficult. cases, chose pivot data make analysis-friendly. See Metadata File Scenarios -depth discussion pivoting took place. package provides 3 utility functions: download_data() allows users programmatically download (unzip) data specific quarter process_data() parses data unzipped .TXT files list R data frames containing Call Report data file metadata compare_metadata() compares two sets Call Report data different quarters

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: can download data particular period using download_data():
code: # Download FCA Call Report data from March 2023 download_data(   year = 2023,    month = 3,    dest = "path/to/some/folder" )

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: can parse data downloaded .TXT files tidy R data frames using process_data(): can also use process_metadata_file() process_data_file() process single metadata data files, respectively. Note: process_data() tested development team Call Report data March 2020 present. Please let us know find issues processing data older 2020.
code: # Process data from March 2023 data_2023_03 <- process_data(folder = "path/to/some/folder")

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: FCA Call Report data changed time, making difficult perform analysis across multiple periods. ensure comparisons can made safely, compare_metadata() returns differences data structure (files, column names, column definitions) two sets FCA Call Report data.
code: # Download data from June 2023 download_data(   year = 2023,    month = 6,    dest = "path/to/some/other/folder" )  # Compare metadata files from March and June 2023 compare_metadata(   dir1 = "path/to/some/folder",   # where we downloaded the March 2023 data   dir2 = "path/to/some/other/folder" )

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: fcall contains following internal datasets: file_metadata contains short description file. remaining datasets represent set “lookup table” dictionaries mapping integer codes raw data plain-English description associated metadata. datasets follow naming convention <file>__<column>, file name raw data file column name column associated metadata file dataset provides codes/definition mapping. example, RCB Call Report data includes column INV_CODE; RCB__INV_CODE internal dataset {fcall} provides mapping integer codes associated plain-English definitions . streamline data retrieval usage, dedicated function named get_codes_dict() integrated package. function allows users load code dictionaries effortlessly providing data name, without need specify exact variable name:
code: # Get codes dictionary information for "RCB" data rcb_dict <- get_codes_dict("RCB")  # Access codes dictionary rcb_dict$codes_dict  # Access associated codes variable name rcb_dict$codes_varname

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: Ketchbrook Analytics also created PostgreSQL database store historical FCA Call Report data traditional, relational schema aligns output data frame structure resulting running process_data(). database allows users execute SQL queries easily analyze Call Report data across multiple quarters. Please, reach info@ketchbrookanalytics.com like access database. provided credentials (form config.yml file) access SQL database, following code can used establish connection database R: Note can connect database tool choose (Excel, Power BI, etc.); limited connecting database R.
code: # Get config config <- config::get(config = "user")  # Connect to database conn <- DBI::dbConnect(   drv = RPostgres::Postgres(),   dbname = config$database,   host = config$host,   port = config$port,   user = config$username,   password = config$password )

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: information dataset spread across two files, metadata file data file: metadata file contains information columns data file, well lookup table(s) translating integer codes found certain columns data file plain-English descriptions (applicable) data file contains actual raw, comma-separated Call Report data, without headers Metadata file names start “D_”. can use file naming conventions link metadata file corresponding data file.

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: metadata file, essence, contains following information variables corresponding data file: Variable name Field type Decimal positions Variable description Metadata stored FCA way straightforward process: metadata file description header can span across multiple lines Information variable stored single line, variable descriptions can span across multiple lines (inconsistent way) metadata files variable names preceded two asterisks (**). asterisks used denote multiple-occurrence columns first corresponds variable stores codes. Files multiple-occurrence columns end NOTE can span across multiple lines. Nevertheless, features metadata files come handy: Variable names single word (.e., variable names separated spaces) Field type either “Numeric” “Alphanum.” always placed variable name Decimal position single-digit integer always placed field type. features allow us use regular expressions process metadata files.

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: purposes parsing files create tidy data frames, metadata files classified following unique scenarios: Scenario 1: variables single-occurrence (.e., variable preceded two asterisks). scenario referred “single”. Scenario 2: set single-occurrence variables followed set multiple-occurrence variables. scenario referred “single_multiple”. Scenario 3: set single-occurrence variables followed set multiple-occurrence variables followed second set single-occurrence variables. scenario referred “single_multiple_single”. classification important corresponding data file different structure depending scenario.

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: general terms, processing workflow data files involves: Reading data Applying column names Performing pivot operations (necessary) Specific pivot operations depend scenario corresponding metadata file

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: simplest scenario. data data file already expected format, task apply column names specified metadata file.

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: case, data data file adhere “tidy” principles. multiple-occurrence columns repeated class within “code” variable. help clarify previous statement, consider data file following (mock) column names: ColumnA ColumnB Code1 Metric1_Code1 Metric2_Code1 Code2 Metric1_Code2 Metric2_Code2 corresponding metadata file likely list column names : ColumnA ColumnB Code Metric1 Metric2 creates mismatch number columns identified metadata file (5) number columns corresponding data file (8). properly apply column names data file, total number distinct codes Code column must determined. column names appropriately applied data file, complete data processing applying long wide pivots.

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: complex scenario, currently applicable one data file (RCR7). Unlike Scenario 2, additional set single-occurrence columns follow set multiple-occurrence columns. observation data file, row contains comma-separated values variables belong first set single-occurrence columns, followed row class ‘code’ variable comma-separated values multiple-occurrence variables, finally, row contains comma-separated values remaining single-occurrence columns. case, initial step reading data involves concatenating lines corresponding observation (using loops). data read, processing similar Scenario 2, except naming columns necessary consider repeating columns middle dataset. naming columns, processing Scenario 2. resulting dataset differs metadata file places single-occurrence columns beginning.

title: Compare FCA Call Report metadata files between two folders — compare_metadata
text: compare_metadata() lists metadata files folder, identifies shared metadata files, compares () number files, (b) file names, (c) file order, (d) file content (using waldo::compare() function).

title: Compare FCA Call Report metadata files between two folders — compare_metadata
code: if (FALSE) {    # Download data from March 2023   path_1 <- tempfile("fcadata")    download_data(     year = 2023,     month = 3,     dest = path_1   )    # Download data from March 2022   path_2 <- tempfile("fcadata")    download_data(     year = 2022,     month = 3,     dest = path_2   )    compare_metadata(path_1, path_2)  }

what: Download data from FCA website — download_data
title: Download data from FCA website — download_data
text: Download data FCA website

title: Download data from FCA website — download_data
Download data from FCA website — download_data
text: year (Integer) year Call Report (e.g., 2022) month (String) month Call Report (e.g., "March"); may also supply integer (e.g., 3) representing month numerically dest (String) path directory data downloaded (unzipped) files (Optional) Character vector, representing names files .zip archive downloaded; default NULL, meaning files downloaded

title: Download data from FCA website — download_data
text: Console message informing user data successfully downloaded (unzipped)

title: Download data from FCA website — download_data
text: FCA publishes Call Report data quarterly. .zip files typically named "March.zip", "June.zip", "September.zip", "December.zip" ( represents 4-digit year). Therefore, valid values month argument limited c(3, 6, 9, 12), unless anomaly FCA's reporting/publishing. Check https://www.fca.gov/bank-oversight/call-report-data--download ensure data available quarter interested .

title: Download data from FCA website — download_data
code: if (FALSE) {    path_1 <- tempfile("fcadata")    download_data(     year = 2022,     month = "December",   # using the name of the month     dest = path_1   )    list.files(path_1)    path_2 <- tempfile("fcadata")    download_data(     year = 2023,     month = 9,   # using the month number (to refer to September)     dest = path_2,     # only download the following files     files = c(       "D_INST.TXT",       "INST_Q202309_G20231106.TXT"     )   )    list.files(path_2)  }

code: if (FALSE) {    path <- tempfile("fcadata")    download_data(     year = 2022,     month = "December",     dest = path   )    processed_data <- process_data(path)    # Access "RCB" data   processed_data$data$RCB    # Access "RCB" metadata   processed_data$metadata$RCB  }

title: Process a data file using metadata and codes dictionary — process_data_file

title: Process a data file using metadata and codes dictionary — process_data_file
text: process_data_file() processes data file according metadata scenario. handles cases variables multiple occurrences organizes data tidy format appropriate column names. function relies read_data_file function actual data reading.

title: Process a data file using metadata and codes dictionary — process_data_file
code: if (FALSE) {    path <- tempfile("fcadata")    download_data(     year = 2022,     month = "March",     dest = path   )    process_data_file(     file = file.path(path, "RCB_Q202203_G20220808.TXT"),     metadata = process_metadata_file(file.path(path, "D_RCB.TXT")),     dict = RCB__INV_CODE   )  }

title: Read a data file based on metadata and codes dictionary — read_data_file
text: read_data_file() reads data file applies necessary processing based metadata scenario. scenarios like "single" "single_multiple", uses read.csv convenient type inference. "single_multiple_single", reads file line line, collapses every (N_CODES + 2) lines, reads collapsed lines using read.table.
